t: Thus*p says the Lord:*s “Keep*pn justice, and do righteousness, For*ld My salvation is*i about to come, And*ld My righteousness to be revealed.
Blessed*ld is*i the man who*i does this, And*ld the son of man who*i lays hold on it; Who*ld keeps from defiling the Sabbath, And*ld keeps his hand from doing any evil.”

Do*ln not let the son of the foreigner Who*ld has joined himself to the Lord*s Speak,*ld saying, “The*ld Lord*s has utterly separated me from His people”; Nor*ld let the eunuch say, “Here*ld I am, a dry tree.”
For*ld thus says the Lord:*s “To*ld the eunuchs who keep My Sabbaths, And*ld choose what pleases Me, And*ld hold fast My covenant,
Even*ld to them I will give in My house And*ld within My walls a place and a name Better*ld than that of sons and daughters; I*ld will give them an everlasting name That*ld shall not be cut off.

“Also*ln the sons of the foreigner Who*ld join themselves to the Lord,*s to serve Him, And*ld to love the name of the Lord,*s to be His servants— Everyone*ld who keeps from defiling the Sabbath, And*ld holds fast My covenant—

Even*ld them I will bring to My holy mountain, And*ld make them joyful in My house of prayer. Their*ld burnt offerings and their sacrifices Will*ild be*i accepted on My altar; For*ld My house shall be called a house of prayer for all nations.”
The*ld Lord God,*s who gathers the outcasts of Israel, says, “Yet*ld I will gather to him Others*ild besides those who are gathered to him.”
All*pn you beasts of the field, come to devour, All*ld you beasts in the forest.
His*ld watchmen are*i blind, They*ld are all ignorant; They*ld are*i all dumb dogs, They*ld cannot bark; Sleeping,*ld lying down, loving to slumber.

Yes,*ld they*i are*i greedy dogs Which*ild never have enough. And*ld they are*i shepherds Who*ld cannot understand; They*ld all look to their own way, Every*ld one for his own gain, From*ld his own*i territory.
“Come,”*ld one*i says,*i “I will bring wine, And*ld we will fill ourselves with intoxicating drink; Tomorrow*ld will be as today, And*ild much more abundant.”
